item.title: Kerala temple deploys robotic elephant for rituals
item.description: Elephants play an important role in Kerala during temple festivals but are often chained and made to stand for hours in extreme temperatures. A temple in the South Indian state has introduced a robotic elephant to conduct its rituals. Could this bring a change in tradition?
item.keywords: DWVC,elephants, Kerala, India, temple festivals, animal welfare, tradition, robots, technology, culture, temple rituals, ethical treatment, societal change
item.media:title: Kerala temple deploys robotic elephant for rituals
item.media:keywords: DWVC, vertical content, mobile content,elephants, Kerala, India, temple festivals, animal welfare, tradition, robots, technology, culture, temple rituals, ethical treatment, societal change

item.title: Nigeria's teen tech wonder
item.description: Joshua Agboola has been programming since he was 6 and today, as a teenager, even teaches other kids to code. The tech prodigy not only spreads knowledge, but also protects others: One of Joshuas's focuses is on how to protect children from malicious content online.
item.keywords: DWVC,Nigeria, Africa, early programming, child programmer, coding education, youth mentorship, tech prodigy, knowledge sharing, child safety online, internet safety, cybersecurity, online protection
item.media:title: Nigeria's teen tech wonder
item.media:keywords: DWVC, vertical content, mobile content,Nigeria, Africa, early programming, child programmer, coding education, youth mentorship, tech prodigy, knowledge sharing, child safety online, internet safety, cybersecurity, online protection

item.description: 10 years in prison for identifying as LGBTQ, five for promoting homosexuality â€” Uganda's parliament has passed tough new penalties for same-sex relations. @DW

item.title: India's first transgender parents
item.description: A couple in Kerala, Ziya and Zahad, have given the transgender community new hope. In order to give birth to a child, Zahad had temporarily stopped his transition and became pregnant and now this couple are parents to a child. This is accepted practice elsewhere in the world but it is believed to be unprecedented in India.
item.keywords: DWVC,India, transgender, parents, LGTBQI+, Kerala, child
item.media:title: India's first transgender parents
item.media:keywords: DWVC, vertical content, mobile content,India, transgender, parents, LGTBQI+, Kerala, child

item.title: Brazil stops Amazon drilling
item.description: Brazil's oil company, Petrobras, is one of the largest in the world, and they have their sights set on the Amazon. But the new government is delaying the plans.

item.description: The lastest IPCC report is a stark reminder that time is running out to change course. But it also confirms that tools are available to limit global warming and effects of climate change.

item.title: Clean energy: the global race for raw materials
item.description: Europe's green energy transition is dependent on China's supply of the raw materials needed to power wind turbines, electric cars and other green technologies.
